page.title: 16WORDSLEY HOSPITAL
page.content: The actual{Wordsley hospital building was once a workhouse, after that it became a prisoner of war camp during the second world war. The main wards are the children's ward, the intensive care unit and the special care baby unit. There are also annexes which are separate buildings where the old people are looked after. There are between six and eight of these.{Wordsley Hospital}is especially known for its plastic surgery, which is in fact the main unit for the{West Midlands. The clock at the hospital shows where all the administration buildings and offices are.Many changes have been made since the new hospital opened. {Wordsley}has not got a casualty or an emergency unit. A new building is being made for the maternity unit. By{Sara McGee}(Age 12)
